NYPLDrexFr4183.Transcription:
…love shuld comOn euery syde þe way she pryde [ ][ ]
                    thyng cowde flye nor gooBut styll went she yt had byn yeWhen hyt was
                    no thyng sooWhen hyt was no thyng Soo[ ] love to comA dew my love
                    I wyll re move[ ]yst wold I had ben doneWhen I so sone grant yow your
                    boneSeyyng ye wyll not come seyng ye wyll not come
NYPLDrexFr4183.Note:
Parts of two verses of a song; portions of pages cut away to fit as
                    endleaves to seventeenth-century song book.
NYPLDrexFr4183.Editions:
Stevens,  John,
                        ed.  
             Music and Poetry in the Early Tudor Court.
         London: Methuen, 1961: 427 (extract only).
